fields.summary: under windows when executing java classpaths with embedded spaces cause the execution to fail

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.description:
using plexus.util.cli as a runtime package, i am constructing command lines to run forked surefire processes - the maven repo is located at c:\documents and settings\<username>\.m2\repository - so any repository based jar has spaces embedded in its file spec - even when the classpath string is placed into its own arg element the java runtime seems to be parsing it and breaking it up into tokens on the white space - the error message is

java -classpath <some classpath string ending in Documents> and 
class and not found

ant's low level java excution class Java13CommandLauncher doesn't exhibit this behavior, using maven1 with the Ant java task and the -X option enabled the arguments that are displayed are 1) the executable 2) -classpath and 3) the whole classpath as a single argument which contains embedded spaces

i suppose that plexus-utils lacks some critical logic that is present in ant's set of java execution classes

here is a sample output from executing the Ant java task in a maven 1 environment: the lines are wrapped cause I cut and pasted them from a cmd window

    [java] [DEBUG] Execute:Java13CommandLauncher: Executing 'F:\java-1.4.2\jre\b
in\java.exe' with arguments:
'-classpath'
'F:\devel4\beanshellscripts\target\classes;C:\Documents and Settings\Administrat
or\.maven\repository\bsh\jars\bsh-2.0b2.jar;C:\Documents and Settings\Administra
tor\.maven\repository\commons-collections\jars\commons-collections-3.1.jar;C:\Do
cuments and Settings\Administrator\.maven\repository\commons-configuration\jars\
commons-configuration-1.0.jar;C:\Documents and Settings\Administrator\.maven\rep
ository\commons-jxpath\jars\commons-jxpath-1.2.jar;C:\Documents and Settings\Adm
inistrator\.maven\repository\commons-lang\jars\commons-lang-2.0.jar;C:\Documents
 and Settings\Administrator\.maven\repository\commons-logging\jars\commons-loggi
ng-1.0.4.jar;C:\Documents and Settings\Administrator\.maven\repository\junit\jar
s\junit-3.8.1.jar;C:\Documents and Settings\Administrator\.maven\repository\jdom
\jars\jdom-1.0.jar;C:\Documents and Settings\Administrator\.maven\repository\mys
ql\jars\mysql-connector-java-3.0.15-ga-bin.jar;C:\Documents and Settings\Adminis
trator\.maven\repository\zrgs\jars\cicerone-1.0.jar'
'bsh.Console'

The ' characters around the executable and arguments are
not part of the command.

fields.environment: win 2k - jdk 1.4.2 - attempting to fork surefire tests for maven2

comments.body:
Slightly off topic:

Andy, I know that plexus developers are thinking about reusing commons-exec (currently inside Jakarta Commons Sandbox) inside m2/continuum and maybe plexus.
Commons-exec is the ant code taken out for reusability. There's some talk to make the API more usable, but this process just started, so the API is not yet stable.
I don't know when commons-exec will be ready but you may want to follow what's going on there.

andy - how is your progress on this?

If you have anything pending to commit, it'd be great if you could do so - I'd like to take a stab at getting this resolved.

Brett,

Sorry, I took the easy way out. I discussed it with Jason and possibly you, at least for part of it, via irc. It turns out that someone who uses windows can move an M2 repository simply by changing the setting for repo.local in the main settings.xml file in user.home. So I moved my M2 repo to a location that didn't include spaces and disappeared the problem in a non-hack manner - even if that is a hack, its nowhere near as severe as "~1" -  ;) - anyway - I suggested to jason that we should add doco that explained same in a prominent location on the M2 site and to the M2 start up guide - and that a marketing pitch similar to "M2 users on Windows - prepare for M2 forking - migrate your M2 repository to a file system location that doesn't contain spaces" might be eye catching enough to get people to both notice and execute the suggestion. especially if they find that it breaks if they don't do it - Jason asked me to send him an email which restated the above and I did do that, my marketing pitch may not have been stated as succinctly, but the message included the necessary content.

The alternative is to work out why spaces are causing the problem on Windows in plexus.util in the 1st place, or to get commons-exec ready for prime time, and you seemed to think that such was a way off.

On a different level, when I went to check in some of my updates I found that I couldn't commit to svn because of an authentication problem. I'm communicating with Jason about that now, I have already sent him an email with my questions and I am awaiting his reply.

I also expect to start up a Confluence page under the Maven project about Surefire - there doesn't seem to be a separate Confluence entry for Surefire at the codehaus.  I'd like to set up a discussion forum that discusses how surefire is supposed to work with the current concerns for web and xmlrpc and how that relates, if it does, to integrating testing frameworks like testng

I think I found the cause, cmd fails in win xp when two arguments have quotes,

Works:
cmd /X /C "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.3.1_18\bin\javac" xxx

Doesn't work:
cmd /X /C "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.3.1_18\bin\javac" "xxx"

with error:
'C:\Program' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.

The solution is not calling cmd under windows, and call the executable directly, but it may break in other systems
btw I didn't see any problem with the classpath entries, they are correctly quoted

The solution is adding quotes at the beggining and the end
cmd /X /C ""C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.3.1_18\bin\javac" "xxx""
Fixed in plexus-utils 1.2-SNAPSHOT, will check the plugins
